main event: A civilian in Phoenix, Arizona, reported observing a ball of fire flying across the sky on July 2, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as having the shape of a flattened grapefruit with a platinum cutting., It was observed at a distance of 7 to 10 miles and was estimated to be 7 to 8 inches in diameter., The object emitted a burning trail extending six to eight feet behind it., The sighting lasted for about 3 to 4 minutes., The weather conditions were clear with a visibility of over 15 miles at the time of the sighting.
witness description: a civilian woman who is far-sighted and regularly scans the sky
